(a) a {@item short bow|phb} and a quiver of 2- {@item arrow|phb|arrows} or (b) a {@item shortsword|phb}

fluff.name: Barbarian
entries: N ELF SITS AT THE CAMPFIRE, CREATING A diagram of the dismembered organs of the monsters dissected in front of them.
A robed human with large glasses flips through her tome of lore, reading the passage that details griffons as one continues its assault on her friends.
A small halfling looks to the stars and makes careful note of the constellation that the sky bears brightly.
All of these heroes are scholars. Though each carries with them an understanding of martial techniques, it is their analytical mind and studied background that make them an asset on their team.

entries.name: Studied Expertise
entries: A scholar comes in many forms, but the most consistent through-line is their time spent in study and their analytical thinking. These heroes do not fight with magic or strength, but with their ability to analyze, categorize, and predict.

entries.name: Knowledge Keeper
entries: Since the dawn of time, there have been those that seek knowledge and forward their field. These are the scholars and they will show up at any time for as long as there is new to be discovered.

entries.name: Creating a Scholar
entries: A scholar is a studied warrior, consider where you gained your expertise. Did you study at a college, or did you have a mentor? Additionally consider how you continue to grow and discover. Do you read ancient tomes or do you take detailed notes of your experiences?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a scholar quickly by following these suggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by Dexterity. Second, choose the sage background.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defence
entries: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies that use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies. You can choose to replace one or both of the skills with an Artisan's tool you have proficiency with instead.

classFeature.name: Scholarly Analysis
entries: Also at 1st level, you can analyze your opponents, predicting their next move. As a bonus action, you can mark a creature as the subject of your analysis as long as you can see them for the next minute or until you analyze another creature. While analyzed in this way you can use intelligence instead of strength or dexterity when you make a melee weapon attack with one hand or a ranged weapon attack.

classFeature.name: Academic Interest
entries: At 2nd level, you can use a bonus action to make an Intelligence (History) ability check to glean information about your opponent. On a success, you glean one piece of information about the creature.

items: One damage resistance, immunity, or vulnerability of the creature if they have any.
What languages if any the creature tends to speak.
The CR of the creature if applicable.
The creature type of the creature.

entries: The DC of this check depends on the rarity of the creature. If the creature is a common occurrence in the world that world such as many humanoids, beasts, and any other creature with extensive research on them, the DC is 10. If the creature is rare but is documented in the literature, the DC is 15. If the creature and info about them are rare, the DC is 20. If the creature is unique or has never been discovered before, the DC is 30.

You only gain information about the average member of the species and do not account for any possible variations the creature might have. For example, if you used academic interest on a human commoner, you could learn that humans typically do not have resistances, immunities, or vulnerabilities, can speak any language but typically speak common, are er 0 without training, can be any alignment, or are humanoid.

classFeature.name: Scholarly Style
entries: Starting at 2nd level your scholarly ability grants you one of the following techniques of fighting.

items: "CUNNING:" You are adept at finding and exploiting weaknesses. You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against the subject of your scholarly analysis and you can take the help action as a bonus action.

"PERCEPTIVE:" You can remain alert even in the midst of battle. You can take the search action as a bonus action and you gain a + 1 bonus to your AC as long as you are unarmored and are not blinded or incapacitated.

"STEADY:" You can steady yourself in battle and keep your mind clear. As a bonus action, you can take the time to aim a ranged weapon, allowing you to make attacks at long range as if it were normal range and reduce the AC benefits of cover by 2.

"TACTICIAN:" You are always in the right spot at the same time. When a creature ends its turn you can use your reaction to move up to your movement speed. As a bonus action on your turn, you can allow one other creature that can hear you to do the same.

"QUICK WITTED:" When you use the Attack action targeting the subject of your scholarly analysis on your turn, you can make one an additional attack as a bonus action. This additional attack deals ld4 damage of whatever type your weapon normally does.

classFeature.name: Academic Major
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a major that you utilize in your scholarly exploits from the list of available majors. Your major choice grants you features at 3rd level and then again at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Academic Major Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your Academic Major.

classFeature.name: Scholarly Discovery
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain one of the following discoveries. You can choose an additional upgrade at 13th level and again at 18th level. You cannot learn the same discovery twice.
Alternatively, each academic major has a list of unique discoveries you can choose from if you are in that major.

items: "Discovery of Arcana:" You learn 2 cantrips of your choice from the wizard's spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for these spells.
"Discovery of Expertise:" You gain expertise in two more skills or Artisan's tools you are proficient in of your choice.
"Discovery of Knowledge:" You become proficient in three skills, tools, or languages of your choice.

"Discovery of Language:" You can learn a new language by spending two hours interacting with creatures that speak that language or reading books written in the desired language and a language you know. You can do this over the course of a long rest.

"Discovery of Technique:" You learn one maneuver of your choice from among those available to the Battle Master archetype. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier. You gain two superiority dice, which are d6 (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Scholarly Analysis
entries: Starting at 9th level, during a long rest you can study and prepare to attune your senses to one of the following aspects of the subject of your scholarly analysis.

items: You can add your Intelligence modifier to checks made to escape grapples from the subject of your analysis.
You can add your Intelligence modifier to charisma checks made to influence the subject of your analysis.
You have expertise in skills made to recall information about the specific subject of your analysis.
You can add your Intelligence modifier to survival or insight checks made against the subject of your analysis.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 10th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Academic Major Feature
entries: At 1th level, you gain a feature from your Academic Major.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Scholarly Discovery
entries: When you reach 13th level, you gain another Scholarly Discovery.

classFeature.name: Information Extrapolation
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you use your academic interest feature, you can choose to learn the chosen information as it applies to the specific creature instead of to the species as a whole.

classFeature.name: Strength of Mind
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you are forced to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw you can choose to automatically succeed. Once you do so you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest. Additionally, you become proficient in charisma saving throws.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature from your Academic Major.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Starting at 20th level, you can take two bonus actions on each turn instead of one. You cannot take the same bonus action twice in one turn.
